author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Republicans in Congress are negotiating a massive legislative package to realize President Donald Trump’s domestic agenda, and it won’t come cheap. Legislation advanced by House Republicans would cut taxes by almost $4.5 trillion over a decade and add hundreds of billions of dollars in new spending for defense, border wall construction, immigrant detention centers and other administration priorities.
title: How Proposed Medicaid Cuts Would Cost 8 Million People Health Coverage

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Qatar’s prime minister defended his country’s offer of a luxury jet to President Donald Trump, telling CNN they would not follow through with the gift if it was deemed illegal and insisting it was not an effort to wield undue influence within the US.
title: Qatar’s PM Defends Jet Offer, Says They’ll Withdraw If Illegal

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro suffered a major setback on Wednesday as the senate blocked his plan to hold a referendum on boosting workers’ rights.
title: Senate Blocks Colombia Labor Refendum in Defeat for Petro

author: Ari Natter
description: A Republican tax plan seeking to cut clean-energy subsidies includes provisions that threaten to end the incentives even earlier than proposed.
title: Republican Tax Plan Targets Clean-Energy Supplies Tied to China

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin named a group of low-level officials to represent his government at talks with Ukraine in Turkey, and gave no indication that he planned to join the negotiations.
title: Putin Names Low-Level Officials for Talks With Ukraine in Turkey

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this week’s Trumponomics, Stephen Moore of the Heritage Foundation argues that Donald Trump and the GOP Congress are on the right path.
title: Why Trade Deals and Tax Cuts May Be a Recipe for US Success

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Sam Dagher
description: Since the toppling of President Bashar al-Assad’s regime in December, Syrians who endured more than half a century of state repression and 13 years of civil conflict finally have a reason for optimism.
title: What’s Happening in Syria, and Why Is Trump Lifting Sanctions?

author: Ryan Chua
description: Seventeen Republican lawmakers urged the Commerce Department to prohibit further sales of equipment from TP-Link Systems Inc., a Wi-Fi router maker whose links to China have raised concerns and prompted investigations in the US.
title: US Lawmakers Call for Ban on China-Linked Router Maker TP-Link

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa plans to hold talks with his US counterpart Donald Trump in Washington on May 21 and hopes to ease a simmering diplomatic row between the two nations.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Heads to US to Ease Tensions With Trump

author: Greg Stohr
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Supreme Court correspondent Greg Stohr previews arguments before the court tomorrow in a case about the power of judges to stall the president’s agenda. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Wants Supreme Court to Rein In Judges Thwarting His Agenda

author: Joe Mayes, Alex Wickham
description: The UK is drawing up plans for a special visa for foreigners who invest significant sums in Britain, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government seeks to blunt the economic blow from recent tax hikes and wider curbs on work permits.
title: UK Mulls New Investor Visa Targeting Key Strategic Industries

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The House Energy and Commerce Committee voted Wednesday to advance Republican plans to cut federal funding for Medicaid, the US health insurance program for low-income and disabled people.
title: Key House Panel Advances Medicaid Cuts in Republican Tax Package

author: Steven T. Dennis, Oma Seddiq
description: Top Republicans are planning to auction $88 billion worth of radio spectrum to wireless broadband companies Verizon Communications Inc. and Elon Musk’s Starlink to help pay for their massive tax package — but the proposal faces stiff opposition from senators concerned about the potential impact to defense systems.
title: Republican Plan to Sell $88 Billion of Radio Spectrum Faces Fight

author: Janet Lorin
description: Harvard University said it will free up an extra $250 million of school money to help pay for research during the coming year after the Trump administration scrapped multiyear federal funding of more than $2.6 billion.
title: Harvard to Fund $250 Million for Research After Trump Scraps Federal Money

author: Kamran Haider
description: Although the air strikes and artillery fire between India and Pakistan have mostly fallen silent, Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif took aim at his counterpart over the border on Wednesday, accusing Narendra Modi of fanning instability and vowing a harsh response to future attacks.
title: Pakistan and India Shift to War of Words After Shooting Stops

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peruvian President Dina Boluarte promoted her justice minister to prime minister Wednesday after his predecessor resigned to avoid being ousted by congress.
title: Peru’s President Names Arana as Her New PM After Cabinet Crisis

author: Emily Birnbaum, Jarrell Dillard
description: New York Republican Nicole Malliotakis said Wednesday there’s an “opportunity” to grow the $30,000 state and local tax deduction cap offered by House GOP leaders in negotiations on President Donald Trump’s giant tax bill.
title: GOP’s SALT Offer Has 'Opportunity' to Grow, New York Lawmaker Says

author: Janet Lorin, Greg Ryan
description: Harvard University President Alan Garber will take a voluntary 25% pay cut for the academic year that starts July 1, a school spokesman said.
title: Harvard President Garber Takes 25% Pay Cut Amid Trump Fight

author: Steve Stroth
description: A Wisconsin state judge indicted for allegedly obstructing the arrest of a Mexican immigrant by federal authorities said the charges should be dismissed because she’s immune from prosecution for her official acts.
title: Judge Indicted for Blocking Migrant’s Arrest Claims Immunity

author: Simone Iglesias
description: Brazil first lady Rosangela da Silva complained to China’s leader about potentially harmful effects of TikTok on women and children during an official dinner in Beijing, continuing a crusade against social media companies that has sparked controversy before.
title: Brazil First Lady Complains to Xi About TikTok’s Effects on Kids

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Jason Leopold
description: The IRS can share taxpayer data with federal immigration officials only in cases involving immigrants with final deportation orders or ongoing criminal investigations, according to a newly unsealed agreement between the Treasury and Homeland Security departments.
title: IRS Can Only Give Tax Data to ICE in Deportation, Criminal Cases

author: Maxwell Adler, Eliyahu Kamisher
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom unveiled a budget proposal that aims to close a $12 billion deficit, marking the third consecutive fiscal year in which state lawmakers need to plug significant shortfalls.
title: Newsom Blames ‘Trump Slump’ for California’s $12 Billion Deficit

author: Marcelo Rochabrun, Maria Elena Vizcaino
description: Peru’s messy cabinet reshuffle is spotlighting how political instability is spreading to what was once a treasured post: the finance minister.
title: Peru’s Endless Political Churn Is Spreading to the Finance Minister Post

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada will cut the lowest personal income tax rate to 14% from 15% on July 1, but Prime Minister Mark Carney’s new government won’t release a budget before the summer months.
title: Carney Delays Canada Budget, Plans to Lower Income Tax by July

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: Keir Starmer received praise from an unlikely source in the House of Commons on Wednesday, when the populist Nigel Farage approved of a speech the Labour prime minister gave two days earlier announcing a crackdown on immigration.
title: Farage Praise for Starmer Shows Labour Unease Over Immigration

author: Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei is tightening up Argentina’s immigration laws as part of his effort to further pare back public spending, making another nod to close ally Donald Trump in the process.
title: Milei Clamps Down on Immigration to ‘Make Argentina Great Again’

author: Eric Pfanner
description: Sanofi SA said it will invest at least $20 billion in the US through 2030, joining other European pharmaceutical companies boosting their American operations as President Donald Trump threatens to impose tariffs and cut prices on drugs.
title: Sanofi to Invest at Least $20 Billion in US Through 2030

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson defended President Donald Trump’s plans to receive a luxury jet from Qatar, saying he doesn’t think the gift raises ethics concerns.
title: House Speaker Defends Trump’s Plan to Accept Qatar’s Luxury Plane

author: Fasika Tadesse
description: Ethiopia’s election board nullified its legal recognition of the party that rules the volatile northern Tigray region and waged a two-year war against the federal government amid ongoing divisions within its ranks.
title: Ruling Party in Ethiopia’s Tigray Region Loses Legal Recognition

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Ukrainian Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko will travel next week to Banff, Alberta, where his counterparts in Group of Seven countries are holding their annual summit.
title: Ukraine’s Marchenko to Travel to Finance Chiefs’ G-7 Summit

author: Dawn Lim
description: Norway’s sovereign wealth fund committed $800 million to Blackstone Inc. to invest in warehouses and logistics, ratcheting up a bet on North American supply chains.
title: Norway Bets $800 Million on Blackstone Logistics, Warehouse Fund

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The White House said President Donald Trump had secured deals totaling more than $243.5 billion with Qatar, laying the groundwork for a bigger $1.2 trillion economic pledge with the tiny Gulf country.
title: US Announces More Than $243 Billion in Deals With Qatar

author: Olga Kharif
description: Morten Christensen says he and four crypto-loving friends will be attending the dinner next week being held for the top holders of President Donald Trump’s memecoin for just about $1,200 each.
title: Trump Memecoin Speculator Says Presidential Dinner Is Costing Him Just $1,200

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Texas is trying to entice more companies to ditch Delaware and incorporate in the state, just like Tesla Inc. and Space Exploration Technologies Corp. did last year at the behest of Elon Musk.
title: Texas Sweetens Pitch to CEOs, Boards With New State Protections

author: Derek Decloet
description: Canada has effectively suspended almost all of its retaliatory tariffs on US products, tamping down inflation risks and improving its growth outlook, according to Oxford Economics.
title: Canada’s New Tariffs on US Drop to ‘Nearly Zero’ With Exemptions, Oxford Says

author: Aaron Eglitis
description: Estonia’s Foreign Ministry summoned the Russian embassy’s top official after a Russian military aircraft violated the Baltic country’s airspace.
title: Estonia Calls In Russian Diplomat After Airspace Violation

author: Li Liu
description: China will suspend export controls and sanctions called the unreliable entity list over US entities, which were announced in April, as part of the trade agreements made by the world’s two biggest economies.
title: China Suspends Export Controls, Sanctions Over US Entities

author: Daniel Carvalho, Vanessa Dezem
description: Brazil has emerged as an early winner from Donald Trump’s trade war with China but needs to get its fiscal situation in order to attract investment and fully capitalize on the global upheaval, according to lower house Speaker Hugo Motta.
title: Brazil Needs Fiscal Sense to Gain From Trade War, Speaker Says

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland said it can cap immigration from the European Union unilaterally under its new agreement with the bloc, a move aimed at deflecting domestic criticism that the deal undermines its ability to manage its borders.
title: Switzerland Says It Has Power to Cap EU Immigration Unilaterally

author: Emily Birnbaum, Steven T. Dennis
description: Wealthy Americans and business investors are among the big winners in House Republicans’ draft tax legislation while targets of President Donald Trump’s ire such as immigrants and elite universities were hammered.
title: Here Are the Winners and Losers in the Republican Tax Bill

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Maxwell Adler
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is proposing to end free health care for most undocumented immigrants, walking back on one of his signature policies as the state faces a projected drop in tax revenue.
title: Newsom Wants to End Free Health Care for Undocumented Adults

author: Patricia Laya, Andrea Jaramillo
description: President Gustavo Petro signed on to Beijing’s Belt and Road initiative in a bid to boost trade and Chinese investment in Colombia, though his top diplomat stressed the US remains the nation’s main ally.
title: Petro Inks China Investment Deal in Test of Colombia-US Ties

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump indicated it’s unlikely he’ll visit Turkey on Thursday for peace talks between Russia and Ukraine, saying he would travel to the United Arab Emirates as planned.
title: Trump Downplays Chances of Turkey Visit for Russia-Ukraine Talks

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Five months ahead of crucial midterm elections in Argentina, the peso has become the cornerstone of Javier Milei’s campaign strategy.
title: How Milei Keeps Argentina’s Peso Strong Ahead of Midterm Vote

author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump is pressing the US Supreme Court to use a dispute over one of his most audacious immigration initiatives as a way to constrain the judges who keep thwarting his agenda.
title: Trump Pushes Supreme Court to Undercut the Judges Who Thwart Him

author: Erik Wasson, Chris Cioffi, Zach C Cohen
description: President Donald Trump’s signature economic package took a major step toward becoming law when the House Ways and Means Committee approved trillions in new tax cuts for corporations, households and small businesses on a party-line vote.
title: Trump Tax Plan Gains Momentum in House as It Heads to Floor Vote

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said his government’s top priority is to transform the nation’s armed forces into Europe’s strongest conventional army to help counter the rising threat from Russia.
title: Merz Commits Germany to Building Europe’s Strongest Military

author: Anna Shiryaevskaya, Priscila Azevedo Rocha
description: Germany’s gas market manager will only step in to support storage injections at the end of summer if needed, but is optimistic that won’t be necessary after a drop in energy prices has revived stockpiling.
title: Germany to Wait Until Summer End to See If Gas Support Is Needed

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany’s new finance minister said the government will still need to identify budget savings even though it can tap into a giant new infrastructure fund and effectively spend as much as it wants on the armed forces.
title: Germany’s New Finance Chief Highlights Need for Belt Tightening

author: Kate Duffy
description: A bipartisan group of US legislators are seeking to repeal regulations that ban civil jets from flying at supersonic speeds over land, in a change that would give startup Boom Technology Inc. a boost in its competition with potential rivals from China.
title: US Legislators Seek End to Supersonic Flight Ban Over Land

author: Dan Wang, Ben Reinhardt
description: To revive manufacturing the US needs to borrow from China’s playbook.
title: Tariffs Won’t Reindustrialize America. Here’s What Will

author: Kate O'Keeffe
description: Six of the top 25 award recipients under a pair of Pentagon programs to bolster small businesses have “troubling ties” to China, including a company whose leader also served on the board of a Chinese state-backed investment vehicle, a Senate investigation has concluded.
title: Senator Flags China Ties in Program to Aid Defense Startups

author: Enda Curran
description: President Donald Trump’s sudden move to lower tariffs on goods from China to 30% from 145% has thrown a lifeline to America’s small businesses who were running low on inventory — and cash.
title: Trump’s Pause on China Tariffs Is Still a ‘Huge Nightmare’ for Small Businesses

author: Leen Al-Rashdan
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s Plane-Dealing Diplomacy Takes Flight

author: Yian Lee
description: China’s hosting of envoys from two of Taiwan’s few remaining allies to an event has caused some concern in Taipei about possibly losing the support on the global stage, further isolating the democracy.
title: China Hosts Officials From Two Taiwanese Allies, Worrying Taipei

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand expects a favorable outcome from talks with the Trump administration to avert the threat of a 36% tariff, after the Southeast Asian nation submitted a range of proposals to boost imports and allow greater market access for US goods.
title: Thailand Upbeat About US Tariff Deal After Bessent Lauds Offers

author: Arsalan Shahla, Patrick Sykes
description: Iran’s top nuclear negotiator said he hopes the US will show a “more realistic approach” at the next round of talks between the two countries.
title: Iran Urges US to Show ‘More Realistic’ Approach at Nuclear Talks

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Tidjane Thiam, former chief executive officer of Credit Suisse Group AG, is running unopposed to lead Ivory Coast’s main opposition party just days after he resigned from the post, a maneuver aimed at bypassing a challenge to his eligibility to fill the position.
title: Thiam Plans Surprise Return as Leader of Ivory Coast Opposition

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said the US is exploring normalizing relations with Syria’s new government after the toppling of President Bashar al-Assad.
title: Trump Says US Exploring Normalizing Relations With Syria

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: There’s been a lot of talk recently about parallels between Donald Trump’s economic policies and the Nixon Shock of the early 1970s. That was when the former president took the dollar off the gold standard, introduced hefty tariffs, and pressured the Federal Reserve to ease monetary policy. The moves sparked stagflation in the US and shook up the global monetary order. Now, given Trump’s determination to rebalance the US relationship with global trading partners and his criticism of the Fed, cou
title: Odd Lots: Perry Mehrling on Trump’s Nixon Shock Echoes (Podcast)

author: Shruti Srivastava, Ruchi Bhatia
description: Indian officials said trade talks with the US remain on track, although there are signs that New Delhi is adopting a tougher approach in negotiations, following China’s defiance of US President Donald Trump.
title: India Signals Tougher US Trade Stance as China’s Tactic Pays Off

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s party wants to choke off domestic funding to independent civil society organizations, in an increasingly aggressive crackdown that critics say is aimed at stopping a surging opposition less than a year before elections.
title: Orban Seeks to Cut Funding to Hungary’s Independent NGOs, Media

author: Nguyen Xuan Quynh
description: Vietnam’s prime minister vowed to step up the fight against trade fraud, smuggling and counterfeit goods, as the nation seeks to address longstanding issues that have proved a sticking point in US tariff negotiations.
title: Vietnam PM Orders Crackdown on Trade Fraud, Counterfeit Goods

author: Arne Delfs
description: Germany’s new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, reiterated a call for the European Union to scrap rules designed to make companies pursue sustainable policies in their supply chains, doubling down on a position that risks igniting conflict with his Social Democrat coalition partners.
title: Merz Risks Coalition Spat With Call to Scrap EU Supply-Chain Law

author: Robert Burnson
description: The Trump administration doesn’t want to reveal just how it determined that some Venezuelans in the New York City area who it’s seeking to deport are members of the Tren de Aragua gang.
title: Trump Officials Resist Sharing How Migrants Were Tagged as Gangsters

author: Rosa Prince
description: The UK government’s paranoia about immigration must not derail the EU reset.
title: Seven Days Will Decide If Britain’s Borders Are Open or Closed

author: Andrea Palasciano, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: NATO allies have started cobbling together an agreement to significantly boost defense spending in a way that may assuage US President Donald Trump’s demand to spend 5% of economic output on the military.
title: NATO Is Sketching Out Plan to Meet Trump Call for 5% of GDP on Defense

author: Colum Murphy
description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva brushed off concern that the Trump administration would punish his country for building closer ties with China, after a state visit to Beijing that saw him sign more than 30 agreements.
title: Lula Says Brazil Unafraid of Retaliation From US Over China Ties

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivia’s President Luis Arce dropped his pursuit of reelection, calling for candidate Andronico Rodriguez to unite leftists ahead of the August vote and fend off a challenge from the right.
title: Bolivia President Arce Declines Candidacy, Calls for Left-Wing Unity

author: David Gura
description: The US has made it clear to China that failing to coordinate on the fentanyl issue comes at a cost, according to Nicholas Burns, American’s former ambassador to Beijing.
title: China Has ‘Price to Pay’ on Fentanyl Issue, Former US Envoy Says

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuador’s Prosecutor General’s Office is preparing to charge former Vice President Jorge Glas and four other men for allegedly having planned the 2023 assassination of presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio, according to social media reports that Glas’ lawyer confirmed as accurate.
title: Ecuador to Charge Correa’s Former VP in Candidate’s Murder

author: James Mayger, Fran Wang
description: China’s surprisingly quick agreement with the US to wind back punitive tariff rates put a spotlight on a Chinese negotiating team that features decades worth of technical trade experience alongside a top aide of President Xi Jinping.
title: China Surrounded Xi’s Aide With Seasoned Experts to Seal US Deal

author: Leen Al-Rashdan
description: President Donald Trump’s long-held fascination with the world of aviation is proving a useful tool for governments and companies seeking to win his favor.
title: In Trump’s World, Aircraft Are Key to Unlocking Political Favors

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Maxwell Adler
description: President Donald Trump’s tariff policies are projected to cut California’s tax revenue by $16 billion in the next fiscal year, Governor Gavin Newsom’s finance department said in a memo.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Will Lower California’s Revenue by $16 Billion

author: Janet Lorin
description: Northwestern University is facing a probe by the US Department of Health and Human Services for alleged civil rights violations against Jewish students, an investigation that could lead to further restrictions on federal funding to the school.
title: Northwestern Investigated by US for Discrimination Against Jews

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said a luxury jet being offered by the government of Qatar would be used as a temporary Air Force One, indicating an intention to accept a gift that has sparked ethical and security concerns in Washington.
title: Trump Says Gifted Qatari Plane Will Be Temporary Air Force One

author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said he’ll consider altering environmental regulations passed by his predecessor, Justin Trudeau, in order to facilitate investment in major projects in Canada, including oil and gas pipelines.
title: Carney Says He’s Open to Changing Green Laws to Boost Energy Projects
